methods.force: Make sure any previous writes to the underlying file through this file accessor are persisted, synchronously.
methods.getImplementationName:
Get a name for the implementing class.  Useful for abstract classes that implement
 LogOutputAppendable or override
 toString.
 The default implementation is correct, but not suitable for high-frequency usage.

:return: (java.lang.String) A name for the implementing class
methods.getOffsetView:
Get an offset view into this FileAccessor.

:param startOffset: (long) - The offset
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.locations.FileAccessor) The new offset view accessor
methods.read:
Fill the supplied buffer with data starting at the supplied offset (position) into this file accessor.
 A successful invocation will fill the buffer from buffer.position(), inclusive, to at least buffer.limit(),
 exclusive, possibly up to buffer.capacity(), exclusive.

:param buffer: (java.nio.ByteBuffer) - A buffer with state appropriate for a call to FileChannel.read()
:param position: (long) - The start position in this file accessor's data space to read from
:return: (int) The number of bytes read, or -1 on error
methods.size:
Request an up-to-date size value for the file data space backing this accessor.

:param requiredSize: (long) - Hint about the minimum size the caller would like as a result
:return: (long) The size of the file data space backing this accessor
methods.truncate:
Truncate the file data space backing this accessor to the supplied size.

:param size: (long) - The new size
methods.write:
Write the supplied buffer (from buffer.position(), inclusive, to buffer.limit(), exclusive), starting at the
 supplied offset (position) into this file accessor.

:param buffer: (java.nio.ByteBuffer) - A buffer with state appropriate for a call to FileChannel.write()
:param position: (long) - The start position in this file accessor's data space to write to
:return: (int) The number of bytes written, or -1 on error

text:
Wrap an underlying FileAccessor, providing an offset view into the underlying accessor's data.
 The offset view will be writable if and only if the underlying FileAccessor is writable.
